intro: Psacadocalymma, commonly known as the rock daisy, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It is native to southern Africa, where it thrives in rocky and arid environments. The plants typically have small, daisy-like flowers with yellow centers and white to pale blue petals. They are often found growing on rocky outcrops and in dry, sandy soils. Psacadocalymma species are generally hardy and drought-tolerant, making them suitable for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
